comment:
Variables:
- \( x \): number of doses of medicine A to be made
- \( y \): number of doses of medicine B to be made

Constants:
- \( c_{A} = 30 \): units of imported material needed to make one dose of medicine A
- \( c_{B} = 40 \): units of imported material needed to make one dose of medicine B
- \( m_{A} = 50 \): units of mRNA needed to make one dose of medicine A
- \( m_{B} = 30 \): units of mRNA needed to make one dose of medicine B
- \( I_{\text{max}} = 300 \): maximum units of imported material available
- \( M_{\text{max}} = 400 \): maximum units of mRNA available
- \( D_{\text{max}} = 5 \): maximum doses of medicine A that can be made

Objective:
Maximize the number of people that can be treated, which is given by \( 12x + 8y \)

Constraints:
1. \( 30x + 40y \leq 300 \) (imported material constraint)
2. \( 50x + 30y \leq 400 \) (mRNA constraint)
3. \( x \leq 5 \) (maximum doses of medicine A constraint)
4. \( y \geq x \) (number of doses of medicine B must be larger than the number of doses of medicine A)
